v1Mo2cb9rPmitEhsQgRXVg.text: great basic burger, nothing gourmet about them (although a bit on the small side) and decent fries. relaxed atmosphere and good music playing. everyone is friendly and service is fast. a great place to pop in and grab a burger if you're in the Marylebone area. i'd say two steps up from fast food burgers.

iHW5qaHjG4nxHqtMK0izRQ.text: sometimes good , sometimes soggy and undercooked meat. simple décor. quick service, good fries. on the plus side, meat is imported and of great quality. would love if they would make their own sauces, instead of big brand names of mayo, ketchup  n mustard.

qP_D3dTD5ocU20K436CKWw.text: This place was another substitue for Patty & Bun after my SECOND attempt there, which had its usual 3 hour queue, but I was quite glad I went. I had a cheeseburger which was pretty good, fries decent and all reasonably priced (There was an offer on).The dive feel was cool and reminded me of some places I had been to over in the CA of the US of A, so yayy for that.Yeah this review is kinda boring.Erm...good food!

NHRjg05aNNL3Gobp1_1p4Q.text: Simple and perfectly cooked delicious burger. Only downside was an inordinate amount of time to order with very few people in the queue.

Su0JH3xoCLVeTRyTdeX6TQ.text: Really good burgers and quick service. They only do a few types of burger but they do then well and you can customise them. Easily better than 5 guys, on bar or better than dirty burger

7uPU6PpE9C7hhTo_Quq7mw.text: After Tommi's Burger Joint closed its temporary shop a few months ago, the reopening in August 2013 at a permanent site nearby was awaited by many fans, including me. Finally, they opened just a few doors down of their first location and occupy a much bigger space to seat more burger lovers. I went to the new Tommi's Burger Joint branch last week to celebrate the booking of my upcoming Iceland holiday  as Tommi's Burger Joint is the UK outpost of an Icelandic business. Basically, not much changed  and that is good news. Because it was already a great place. As I wrote when I reviewed the initial branch, Tommi's Burger Joint is not a fancy burger restaurant, but a plain and down-to-earth burger joint that offers simple and simply tasty burgers for a reasonable price. When I went this time, there was a again mixed crowd as usual. With reference to Patty & Bun just a few meters away, be prepared to wait a few minutes here as well  but at least most likely you will not need to queue outside My burger was nicely cooked, somewhat juicy and easy to eat without causing a big mess. The bun coped well with the patty  probably because the burger is not too big. It was definitely big enough for me anyway. The fries do the job, taste good but are nothing to be excited about. I will soon be back at Tommi's Burger Joint for another Icelandic treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom

MMr20axqmVq1Wnyniv9_Rg.text: They use the best available meat in their burgers, need I say more? Spoil yourself as well a thick and delicious milk shake. Nice and friendly atmoshere

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Laugh of the day!

Mq4chRdUiZffcpv5D2kMTw.text: Tommi's Burger Joint is a busy no extras kind of place. Situated in the lively and fun Marylebone area it is a short walk from fun bars, shopping, and other burger joints. I went to Tommi's with a number of other bloggers from the London scene to taste their burgers. I asked for the best burger that they make and the recommendation was the Steakburger with cheese, bacon, and béarnaise sauce. Other toppings on the burger included tomato, lettuce, and chopped onion. Upon my first bite I'll have to say that the béarnaise and steak are what make this burger. My next few bites highlighted the bacon which was pre-cooked, and waiting in a bin. Ultimately, this bacon was not to my liking as it was too crispy and borderline burnt. I pulled out some bacon and focused on the hollandaise, cheese, and béarnaise. My impressions were that this burger was quite good... really good. The soft bun, and creamy & rich béarnaise made this burger. You could almost eat this burger without the beef; since the veggies, cheese, and béarnaise were so flavorful. The tomato is a bit confused on this burger and it would probably be better off without it. The beef is semi-juicy with a loose pack and a good flame grilled char. Overall, this burger has some great elements but it also has a few misses like the bacon and tomato. I ordered the best they have and they served me up a few misses. If you go to Tommi's ditch the bacon and tomato and you'll definitely have one of the best burgers in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Steakburger with Bearnaise

V3uatnjajMZdoB02XjHmOw.text: Long lines but tables turnover quickly. Good quality hamburger but the lettuce-tomoato-onion was not great quality. Great fries and friendly counter service. Beer available too. Just open recently so I'll give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Just open. Doing well so far

OQ4IHXTEQEJAoifcMwyCXg.text: A little less chips and a little more burger would be nice. The bun is not crisp enough either as one would expect. Service is quick and staff are polite.

rD9Db_i-KYWPOWuSaAf1CQ.text: Excellent burgers with fabulous taste in a great culinary area of London. The bread seems homemade. If you ask them with chips, they give you a basket with more than you can eat, crunchy on the outside but soft on the inside. I've been there quite a few times already and never been disappointed.

TXqUzt6IEr03XmykTBfucA.text: Average burgers, quite expensive.I had the standard burger (+cheese), fries and drink. And was underwhelmed. It's nice that they are generous with their condiments. However the burger itself is not exceptional. The fries are bland. Pales in comparison compared to other burger joints like Patty & Bun or Five Guys.

zX_bHzmW7WlyzJxmZCWz0g.text: I am starving and pregnant and this definitely fulfilled my burger craving for the day. My burger was cooked perfectly well-done, but it was a smallish patty. There were ample fries in my order, which were ok as well, nothing amazing. I was so hungry though that I was happy after stuffing my face here. It took a bit too long to get my burger, but once again, probably because I was getting hangry.

vwCjFL-ypmkc1MLPkVj8WQ.text: I ate here the other day after craving a burger. The burger was pretty small and decently rare when I ordered it medium, good flavor though. The fries were narrow cut and you got a TON of them. They were playing some hip rock music that made me feel like I was in a cool place and I enjoyed that. I might go back if I am in the area and craving another burger.

lkoeO9lztlZ_1lO8_Qu70g.text: finally made it to Tommi's! i've got to say that it's better than Patty & Bun...why? the burgers are just as good, it's not as busy and it's cheaper! plus they give you as many condiments as you like. classic cheeseburger with bacon, fries, coke - £11. quick service. no waiters. decent seating but round the back smells like toilet, at least its a clean toilet.very impressed, would come back for sure.

r7qzeEH4CVpPBY0s6om0-Q.text: Re-opened as a permanent business, I visited on soft launch night (5th August) to give this place a whirl after reading rave reviews about their pop-up. Menu is very straightforward: 4 choices of burger (regular, cheese, veggie or steak), fries and 4 flavours of milkshake (strawberry, chocolate, vanilla or coffee). Everything is made to order, so after you queue up to place your food request you find a place to seat yourself while the staff weave their magic and present the results to you when completed. There is no formal seating arrangement, so all chairs and stools are snatched up on a first-come first-serve basis. Prices seem pretty reasonable - at £5.90 for the regular, it's cheaper than most other gourmet burger vendors like Byron, GBK, Honest or 5 Guys. Tommi's seemed to be well staffed and the food was generated in brisk time - I received my milkshake within 5 minutes of placing my order and the burger appeared about 5-10 minutes afterwards. The shakes are purportedly made from Icelandic ice-cream - don't know what that entails, but mine was pretty scrummy. The steakburger was melt-in-your-mouth gorgeous - even the addition of lettuce seemed to enhance it. A nice touch was the ability to serve yourself condiments (relish, pickles, mustard etc)  from a tray on the serving counter.Overall an excellent burger vendor.

r8upIjIxb6ObhjpKMOC0_w.text: Service was nonexistent and the place is a tad small but their burgers were nice and tasty, with plenty of fries. Recommended if you want a burger in the area and Patty&Bun is too busy.

2GyUF1nXDcSnjGG2wOj0ig.text: So after reading brilliant reviews of Tommi's on here, I decided that I needed to branch out from my usual burger fix and go here... which turned out to be a horrible decision and a huge regret! The burgers were so distasteful, mainly because the meat tasted like it was processed and similar to something you'd get in a school cafeteria- it was horrible. I couldn't even really finish my burger as the meat just had a gross taste to it. The chips were okay, nothing special. However, the only thing that saved Tommi's was their shakes! They do proper thick American shakes and to be quite honest, might just be the best shake I've found in London. So in conclusion... definitely NEVER coming back here for a burger (as I'd rather go hungry than have to eat a burger from here again) but I will definitely be back for a shake!

DBdS9W8z3U_XHb6FF9exMg.text: Whoa! Smells good. Looks good. But the burger I got to go was raw. I had to throw it out. If you go, make sure they cook it. I asked for medium well. I got rare.

YwPidkUMZP9_kHUTooRv1A.text: Traditional, a little 'hip' fast food diner, quick bite, heavenly juicy cheese burger, amazing sauce (I even bought an extra one to take home with me), sauce dribbling everywhere, super nice service. The vegetarian friend of mine, who came in with me, was also happy as a clam. Her meatless zone offered some amazingly tender, smoky heavenly magic. Fresh tomatoes, fresh lettuce, fresh onion. The meaty juiciness in my case was medium rare felt more like rare, was well spiced, superbly fresh and generous size. Fries could use some exciting spice, but still were tasty. Thin, crisp, hot chips, which didn't seem  greasy.

_yoQUyHdoyBxyjxtuxXg5A.text: Took a bit of fun finding but absolutely worth it. Great cheeseburger moist and very tasty . Can recommend this place

Rw18CjSnU7WjKqzJXMNsVA.text: Used to eat at Tommi's when he was at the old address. Love grabbing a quick burger and fries here... Cool place, cool people and yummy burgers !

a-NSCKd-AogAOz78-3XBzg.text: By far the best burger in London (if you know any that are better please let me know!) After waiting months and months for Tommi's to re-open, I headed back, a bit worried that the quality might change. But Tommi's never disappoints. The burgers are amazing, the fries are perfect, the Icelandic milkshakes are HEAVENLY. And free unlimited coffee is always great. Definitely my favourite burger place in London, and one that is consistently good. I couldn't recommend it enough.

Y8miGai-sjHgDXUg_G34qA.text: Terrific no-nonsense burgers (Would rate this among top 5 in London). Great service. Buzzing location. Friendly (Icelandic) staff. It's clear that they take pride in what they do. And "Tommi" really had put his heart into this place.Bonus - not overrun by the great unwashed or hipsters

tGvov-4HOuAPW-E-ZeATpg.text: Queues!  This place has only been open for a couple weeks and it's already rammo. I liked the dive bar feel and the help yourself condiment bar. Free coffee is also a lovely bonus.The fries are shoestring (not my cup of tea) and the burger was tasty - *but* the veggie patty seemed store bought to me. I've had some lovely home-made versions in restaurants recently so this felt like a little cop-out.  It tasted a bit like the BK bean burger, which used to be a teen favourite of mine... but for the price here, I would have expected a bit more...I'm afraid with Patty and Bun & Honest Burger so closeby I probs won't return here - but I'm glad I tried it :)

D8ungqAEDeQ2e8j2WpahCA.text: I didn't get to try them when they opened last time! I was waaay too slow! So when they opened again, I put them back on my bucket list. Luckily, got a chance to try them last week and I'd like to say it's a solid contender for my top burger spot. The burger was succulent and juicy and just really really tasty. P+B purists shoot me now, but I much preferred tommi's to Patty and Bun. P+B didn't hit THAT spot. They offer a selection of sauces that you grab yourselves including a house jar of pickles and jalapenos. Sliced for easier eating too. (definitely bringing my pickle loving mate back here, she's going to go gaga over gherkins) But it's not cheap. Its a tenner for burger and chips and a drink. (don't think the shakes are included in that price!) But it's WORTH IT. worth every bite and then everything seems right with the world.

RZBf-nuzKrFXd2WLHWEGBA.text: Tommi's is a real tiny burger joint with Icelandic roots, in fashionable Marylebone. The place only has seating for around 30 people, meaning at meal times, it's quite difficult to get a seat, let alone a standing table. The interior is generally nice, think wooden hipster shack. Upon arriving, I'd already memorised the menu and it was clear there would only be a choice between beef and a single choice of veggie burger. As a non-beed eater, I was okay with this, and ordered the Veggie Burger, with a portion of fries, some of the well reviewed Bernaise sauce and the Icelandic ice cream strawberry milkshake.The milkshake is immense. My fave part of the meal. It comes supplied with a straw, but forget that, throw it out and pick up a spoon from the condiments area. That's how you're going to drink the super thick shake. Whilst I ordered strawberry, there were ony hints of it, leaving me to assume the vanilla ice cream that made up the majority of the shake simply overpowered the small quantity of strawberry extract/sauce added. It was delicious nonetheless. The veggie burger was good, but less impressive. It's a veggie burger, that didn't taste like it was from the freezer (even tho it probably was), only because of the charred method of cooking. The fries too, were nothing special and actually quite pricey for pretty much frozen fries. The Bernaise sauce, excellent, but a little wasted on chips. I slathered some into my burger and that improved things.In all, the place is definitely overhyped...The veggie burger was not great, nor did the beef ones look much better. The milkshake was good, but doesn't make up for the main attraction (the burgers). To top it off, it was pretty pricey at around £14+ for the lot. Especially since I wasn't seated either. Like others say, it's worth an initial try, but I probably won't be back, after all, there's only one item I can really eat here and plenty more burger places in London!

sLptSew_aYTgYS7gweJefA.text: So I'm absolutely kicking myself for not coming here sooner. Tommi's has been on my radar since they were a pop-up, but living in the suburbs, I knew I'd have to make a special trip (and never made it). I even told my Icelandic friend about the place, and she raved about it, but yet I didn't make it out. Until last night. After a night of drinking in Westminster, we were figuring out dinner, and since my Icelandic friend was there, I suggested Tommi's, and she was totally on board.As I had never been, I wanted to try everything! Originally I was drawn to the £10 deal: A burger, fries and a can of soda. It's a pretty good deal for a burger place like this I'd have to say. However, once I saw the milkshakes on the menu (made from Icelandic ice cream!), I knew that my order would be different. I also was HUNGRY so I opted for the double burger with cheese and bacon. The other half got the steak burger (alas they were out of Bearnaise sauce), and we split an order of fries and a vanilla milkshake. Add in some water and a bottle of beer, and we were good to go!The place was packed at about 8:30 on a Wednesday night, but by 9:30 it had emptied out, so if you don't like queues, come late! There's a surprising amount of seating in the place as well, and even though there was a fair number of us, most of us found seating by the time our burgers came out (as the previous people left before our orders were ready). There's also a few movie posters floating around on the walls, but the one that I appreciated the most was the poster for "Dancer in the Dark" (starring Bjork!) on the wall while heading downstairs to the toilets.So the milkshake came out first. And it was amazing. The vanilla was super tasty and the shake was really thick and creamy. Totally recommend one! The burgers and fries were next. We decided to split, so I ate half of my double burger. It was delicious. Cooked perfectly medium rare and juicy and it just melted in the mouth. The steak burger was really good as well (and also perfectly cooked), but after having such a mouthful of meat (yeah I went there) with the double burger, I wasn't as impressed. The other half preferred the steak. So much so that he decided we needed another steak burger and another order of fries! The fries are nicely crisp and hot, but not as interesting as some of the chips at other burger places (but who cares really?) After the second burger, I conceded that the steak is indeed better.So this may possibly be my favorite burger place in London so far (although I know I have more to go). The burgers are perfectly cooked, juicy and delicious. It can be reasonably priced (£10 special!) or you can go crazy and spend a good amount of money (a double steak burger with Bearnaise and cheese will run you around £15 just for the burger) so it's a good place for when you're out with people who are on a budget and you want something a bit nicer. I've always been told that Iceland is the place for hot dogs, but apparently they can pull off a fantastic burger as well!

l-15BVb0Oimvqw8ITGvlJQ.text: This is slightly better then five guys burger wise great burger favorite ATM in london but their fries are sub par nice service great burger uncomfortable seat kinda of a eat and split joint but dun matter food is good enough to warrant return visits. Just hope the would add onion rings.FYI they have a very nice veggie burger to worth trying out. Enjoy

-wmAouP8PwtAEjL8D-KTDQ.text: Clean and cool decor, good music and friendly atmosphere. Just what you need if you're just looking to chill out with decent food.When it comes to the food, this is simply a very good burger without any fuss. Maybe not one of those "best I ever had" burgers, but you just can't fault it. Although not many sides, the chips are good and they have a great selection of beers. They even had Icelandic X-mas beer!The piece de resistance, the sauces mentioned by other posters, are also great. Anything you want, get it from the counter.

mt-MBK_lrfrK_sgucqxeww.text: Solid burger! And a great place to go if the queue at Patty & Bun is just too unbearably long, which it was when we got there. Our group of 5 got lucky... we arrived and there was a minimal queue and by the time our orders were fulfilled we got a table for all of us. Score! Good burger karma or something.I had a cheese burger with fries and a soft drink (aka the offer of the century) and it was delicious. My boyfriend had the steak burger and raves about it... says it's the best he's ever had (...Shake Shack included), take it or leave it. I tried some of his strawberry milkshake - so thick, it's like ice cream (almost) but pure and delicious. If you can fit it in along with your burger & fries, go for it.All in all, a great experience. Definitely one of the top burger destinations in London these days.

8qUc3yaHIzxA1gUYDazUvg.text: This burger restaurant has a good reputation.  When I told my colleagues at work that we were thinking of coming here, they gave the appropriate oohs and aahs.  After trying it out myself, I agree that they have nice burgers and the staff are friendly, but nothing that really makes it stand out from the others.  If I am in the area and feel like a burger, I would come here.  But I wouldn't make a special trip.When you turn up, it is best to be patient.  You can expect the place to be full and you may be lucky to find a table for your group.  Having said that, we were lucky and a table for two sprung up conveniently after we had placed our order at the counter.We had a cheeseburger each and some fries to share.  The patty is cooked medium, which I like, but others may find it underdone.  The fries were just the right kind of tasty and I was happy to finish them off when my wife had had enough.

3mGLnT15nfXqF-jxBN3PxQ.text: Yup good burger. A snack-sized, simple everyday burger. Free coffee, lots of free extras. A bit too expensive for what you get. A the £8 range, you are either in the big burger range or gourmet burger, and this is really neither. If it were £5 I'd be here everyday, as it is I probably won't be back.

l9qRVflYPbbP_DiIoEIfDg.text: Thick burger and perfectly cooked. Best I've had outside of the US! Would definitely recommend if you're in the area. Also, great pickles, condiments, and environment.

WxUKQAVnZBoi-XcsWrczqw.text: Being from the states and have ate at a number of buger places there, and this was a very nice surprise to find a buger jont that surpasses even 5 guys bugers here in London. Very friendly staff and quick to deliver your food. If you want a hood hamburger in the area,  i recommend the place!

M0DuAUbrHW7WlTt1b2646w.text: Firmly impressed with this place. Didn't get the chance to go when it was a pop-up shop, but glad it has found a permanent place in Marylebone.The burger is really good, the fries are seemingly endless and the meal deal is quite worth it. Overall, we were impressed with the whole experience, especially after the underwhelming experience at Shake Shack. Tommi's definitely goes high up the list for me in this new Burger explosion that is happening in London recently.

GwKfVMwlxdXmHDYYTFxlzg.text: Was taken for lunch here on Monday. DELISH! The burger wasn't char-grilled and the meat tasted fresh and delicious. The fries were also really, really good.Loved the run down (but very clean!) feel of the place and the sauce selection was pretty darn good too. Being a big burger fan, I am used to going to a lot of American style places... I therefore was pleasantly surprised that they had English Mustard (which is actually a rarity in some burger bars). All together a decadent and calorie fueled luncheon was enjoyed - would love to go back and see what it's like in the evening too!

Fb_ml4PahxZ_XUhErwHJhA.text: Tommi's Burger Joint is now a chain operating on a worldwide basis. Iceland, Denmark, Norway, Germany and United Kingdom. Well, is this the new McDonalds? Not at all. This is great burgers. Simple, but full of flavour. I really like the atmosphere too.

07wZIqb8Xd6ffT5vC2sQNQ.text: This is a simple place which simply offers burgers... choose your burger, veggie burger, or steak burger, add cheese, bacon, etc. order some fried, and you get a great burger like you want it.The place is not too big, but gives a nice and cosy atmosphere, with friendly staff.No idea what link they have with Iceland but they also offer some nice Icelandic beer :-)

q1cXf2G9aSx6Tz_RZW1YzA.text: It makes me sad that I have to write this review; if I had reviewed it last year, the Tommi's pop up Joint would have gotten an instant 5 stars. I travelled quite a long way to get to the new Marylebone site, and maybe it was the sky-high expectations set by Tommi's previous incarnation, but I was left a little disappointed. The menu is still the no nonsense I'll-have-this-this-and-this affair, which is good for people like me who have serious anxiety issues over making any form of choice. Cheese burger, vanilla shake, fries, boom. Simple. With such a pared down selection, each element needs to be pretty great, but this time around, none of them were quite there. The fries were a little underdone for my liking, and the milkshake was good, rich and thick, but nothing to ride home about. The burger was pretty delicious until the centre where there was an overwhelming burst of mustard. I know on the menu it does say all burgers come with mustard but this was overpowering and dominated what would have been a really great burger. The new location is definitely a lot more practical. You can actually find a place to sit (and breath). That being said I quite enjoyed the scuzziness of the old location, the hustling for seats, the sharing of tables, the crammed cabin-like feel. Maybe the discomfort was all part of the appeal - it set it apart and I remember it as an event culminating in the best burger I've ever had. Now it's surrounded by hoighty-toighty boutiques and expensive handbags, and it doesn't quite feel right. I will probably come back, the memories of that illusive heralded burger still causing my heart to beat a little faster. I hope they can hit that mark again.

SyMKn4bSHQTHNV6yDsng-w.text: I went up to this place after seeing it on a few top ten burgers of London lists. Got served rather quickly.Ordered their burger with extra bacon.The bun was ok. The patty itself was quite tasty. In sharp contrast the condiments and toppings were typical of any burger joint. While the burger looked aesthetically pleasing, once I got at it the lack of structural integrity became rather apparent. Overall it was a decent burger but I really question all the rave reviews this place gets.

IP7IhuWsA_E_sOjkUSZkmw.text: Nice burger but nothing compared to others like Patty & Bun or Shake Shack. Took the basic cheeseburger and fries. Nice for a quick one but don't expect much

HhgCe-kB6rcAhTgmA1N0Dg.text: Good burgers and quick but you may have to wait in the line to go in which is the only con.

9WZNyi2zPbyDA5kP9S92xA.text: I arrived late so my burger was waiting for me and it came pretty much still moo'ing. I couldn't eat it. Kinda yucktastic. BUT i'll definetly go again and try and try again. Everyone i know loves this place so i'll give it another go.

oGSOGCrnWtap8HspQG1Xiw.text: What a fantastic burger place! Thank god my friends told me not to be put of by a ling line. The burger joint is quite small, so the line was all the way on the street. I guess it's normal in lunch time.The interior is really charming! Spotlights like from Christmas tree, menu written on a paper bag, bob Marley playing and really nice looking guys behind the bar. We ordered a steak burger with cheese and fries. When the burger finally arrived it was absolutely delicious! The meat was tender, sauces nicely balanced and I could actually taste the lettuce and tomatoes.We sat by the window on bar chairs byt the door. It was. A nice spot with a view, only a bit cold as the door was open. On the other hand, I can't complain because at least we were not smelling like burgers later in the office.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Steak burgers
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Steak burger
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Seating

gSHEQ1w62ANc8NtbzjGnWw.text: Tommi's is back! All hail, Tommi's is back!I was a little concerned that the gritty feel of what had to be one of the best burger joints in London would be lost when I heard they were moving onto Marylebone High Street - I am so glad to see they even moved their chicken-wire covered black boards and that big portrait of old Tommi with them.The queues are long, yes. It is hard to get a seat at lunch time,yes, but the burgers are immense and well worth the relative hassle. If you don't want to be involved in the rush quite so much, come a little later, after 1pm, and you should be fine.Something I haven't tried yet as they are new additions for this new venue, is the milkshakes. They look incredible though, so it won't be long until I dive in.Another thing that has changed is that it is no longer a BYOB, they actually sell beer on site, which is fantastic when you sneak out for a cheeky Friday afternoon burger and beer.Welcome back Tommi, I missed you.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Free coffee

eS0zKvAXUs2P-_tCZZImZg.text: Oh my oh my oh my. I totally love this place and if you haven't been yet then why are you still reading this - leave for it now! After getting a top tip from my friend Alex to check out this joint, we ventured down on a wet and windy London lunch time, eager to tap into their carnivore delighting selection - and even as soon as we got through the door I knew we'd made the right choice!As we ventured in, the smell of searing patties filled the air and it was a good sign that it was so packed you could hardly get in the door. Deep beating Hiphop of Outkast's 'So Fresh and so Clean' was rocking the joint at lunchtime making us throw a few shapes while waiting in line for our order of Steak burgers!What came were some of the most succulent juicy burgers that I've ever put into my mouth - and this is saying something as my Dads nickname for me as a kid was 'the Burgermeister' The fries were crispy and just what you'd expect from this place - their condiments selection was also off the chart and greatly appreciated by myself and my European chums. I think Tommi's is the sort of place you could go if you wanted a lunch time meal, a quick evening dining experience or maybe something to take away - pretty well priced at around £7-9 a burger - not to be missed if you're in London (or even travelling from afar)

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom

TikmyydltEfbrVSr5-f8xQ.text: Perfect burger. Nice crew. This and P&B are my favorite burger spots in London.For some reason in London the burger are kinda tiny everywhere, but Tommi is super delicious, if you're really hungry you might need 2 burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Cheese burger.
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Line for burger

Y_BWwX7nkvCbNzBgvgI3rw.text: After my first choice, Patty & Bun, informed my girlfriend and I that they had, ironically, run out of buns, I pulled up Yelp and found Tommi's; reviews were good, it was close enough--I figured it was a good alternative. As an American in London, I didn't know what to expect from a burger joint, but what I found was familiar and delicious. Small spot, tables to sit at, but it's a tight squeeze, which adds to the ambience/overall experience. Burger was a good size, and the fries were exactly what I was looking for. A great time through and through.

RfvYc5f757DEBqyXc2euaQ.text: Over-hyped: Tommi's gets one star for not giving me food poisoning and another for its decor reminiscent of up and coming burger joints in NYC where the atmosphere is fun, relaxed and even inviting.The main event, however, was entirely disappointing: a medium cooked cheeseburger really lacked tenderness or any unique flavour. They were stingy on the lettuce and onions and the sauce was nothing to rave about (a mix of ketchup and mustard). It revels in its simplicity as apart from bacon, there are no other customisable toppings. It was probably the most average burger I've had in a while. Whilst chewing, I had a fleeting thought that even McDonald's could throw together a tastier one ...and I don't particularly like theirs!For me, if a burger joint can't deliver on its main premise, it has to be avoided, no matter how inviting the decor is. Give this a miss.

AsnsMSuIljSHLb5XgSnSwQ.text: I still haven't found a burger joint in London that can compare to the awesome burgers I'm used to in NYC (PJ Clarkes, The Burger Joint, JG Melon...to name a few).  The burger was simply just okay - it didn't blow my mind, and we most likely won't be returning.  The atmosphere can be described as fun, casual, laid-back rock and roll American style.  Great selection of condiments to add "flavor" to your burger.  My search for the best burger in London shall continue...

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Place your order at the counter
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Order of the Century: Burger + Fries + Soda 9.90

jNT3HZVyLFU8hIAjALzbAQ.text: After all the great reviews for this place, I was eager to try it. As always, it's pretty easy for me: pick a couple of friends who already live there and are so lazy they are not moving out of W1, and go!And... I was disappointed. A lot.The place is nice, with the boards, the red phone (damn, I need to buy a red phone, then I can alternate between boston accent and russian accent, that would make me laugh for at least a couple of years), the waitress and the open-plan kitchen (I don't know whether this is correct word, anyway a kitchen customer can see!).The problem is actually the food: I can't get why grant and Hannah loved it so much, maybe the place changed its burger dealer or something because the food was really not that good.First, the burger: I love a nice chopped burger, that was almost pureed meat, which is bad, really bad. It was more on the dog food range rather than the human delicious burgers. Fries are just meh: crisp and hot of course, but very tiny, and that makes them basically flavorless, and very, very salty. it's just like licking a salt pillar, somebody likes it, me not. And it was not a mistake, as we ordered two portions in different times in order to understand whether it was just an error followed by lazyness or not. But they have Bearnaise sauce. Acid bearnaise sauce. bahStill have to try the milkshake, but I really don't want to enter in this place any more so..... I'm probably just avoiding the place!Moral of our story: went out of this place, reached tommy and bun just 200 metres after and had our proper, damn good burger.

frKJ1lfha9kAhJKVRPd9XA.text: Went here with a couple of hungover colleagues for a spot of lunch. It was quite delicious.From the quick quick service, the crunchy thin french fries to the succulent meat, Tommi hit the nail on the head.Apparently they do amazing shakes too so will have to go back for that!

KWw3icBwYZ2-RsVfz9nfJg.text: In my opinion, Tommis offer the best straight to the point burger in London. However, with a burger scene as big as London, simplicity is not always wanted! I have been here four times so far and have enjoyed every time, but have been hoping for an improvement in the burgers each time. What I like the most about the place is the fact that they offer a range of condiments for free, which is a nice touch to go on your clean cut fries. The place can get busy, so expect to wait a bit for a seat if you aren't lucky. Worth a visit, but nothing overly special (good if patty and bun down the road has an hour queue!)

6Nu7SRULVO1DXKjG4cOHXg.text: You got to love topsy turvy mealtimes. First we had cinnamon buns and the. We though, hmm let's get a burger! So after a fab yelp event, Alex S, Jane G, Ray C, Becky H and myself (among others) trotted over to Tommy's. This was a breath of fresh air in an otherwise slightly overly pretentious part of London. Cool, quirky, laid-back and good burgers. Stools were uncomfy but there was free coffee! Good price for a cheeseburger with bacon (£7), the menu was written on haphazard bits of cardboard - I like that, bit of kookiness. Good burger with nicely toasted bun, only 3 stars cos in London you can find better at Grill Shack or Shake Shack. Normally I would love this place, but too much good competition. Shame

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. It may be in a paper cup, but it's free!
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. All of the choice on all of the signs!

b_JK9ZVDImL0CTAObGyiiQ.text: Had dinner on a weekday: three burgers and a chicken burger. The burgers took a little long to arrive but they were packed. Definitely would go back.

T_UNs6YoTScCdgXIat0OOA.text: McDonald's quality burger for 3Xs the price.This place is completely overpriced and offers nothing special in the way of a burger. Cheap buns, over fried food, and over processed cheese it's a major letdown. There are so many better places to choose from.

e5gt8u5_8ebPVMmA_U09jw.text: Hmmm. I have to admit that when I think of my experience at Tommi's, it does work. You pay, you get, you eat, you leave.Unfortunately it is nothing more than the sum of its parts. The staff seem disillusioned and disinterested, and although the burgers are nice, they certainly aren't memorable.When you pit Tommi's against all of the other burger joints that have appeared recently, it just gets lost in the crowd.

iJ52W_orENgiUtUITpiULA.text: Out off all the burger joints in london this is defiantly in my top 3, secondf aftter patty and bun.The burgers were delicious and the menu isnt as long as your arm which helps when deciding what to order! It has a great american style atmosphere about it.

TYFjoWLC78m1NZL9zi9vVQ.text: Always free coffee for Tommy's customers.  But is this why I show up here? Hell no! This place moved from a tiny location to something somewhat bigger. And I love it. Lots of windows, many more places to sit down. Did I mention they have the best burgers in town? If you ask me, they do.Double steak Burger, with Bacon and Cheese. French fries and BBQ sauce and you are good to go. Or stay - whatever you like. 300g of meat got me through the day. This was another great experience here. Yes we had to wait for ages, but they gave us a voucher fr a free burger for our next visit. Fair enough.So guess what. I am coming back! Sooner or later

EpxYXxjo259LcucBUoBtZg.text: I must say I can't really fault this place. It makes me fecking salivate even thinking about it.Quirky signage, Motown blasting on the radio, fairy lights strung haphazardly around the place, and a general overall happy vibe is the first thing that got me excited.Then there's the burgers. Juicy, delicious, homemade burgers.And the piece de resistance, the sauces. Bottles of them line the counter, just waiting to be dolloped and poured and soaked all over your choice of food, or take away as much as you freaking like with you. We're talkin BBQ sauce, we're talkin homemade relish, we're talking homemade cocktail sauce. We're talking SAUCE. And plenty of it.Go there. Go there now!

QRzyrUoPnMBBoDF-e_OYRw.text: This place reminds me of "Burger Joint" hidden behind a heavy velvet curtain in the glossy lobby of Le Parker Meridien in midtown Manhattan. Likely that is also where the name comes from, or maybe I'm giving New York too much credit. Then again, the name. And the fact that it purports to be a greasy dive in a rather fancy neighborhood.The burgers are upgraded junk food; McDonald's 2.0. Good ingredients masquerading in paper wrappers and the kind of shiny flimsy bun that smushes so well into a burger patty. That makes it a fun experience - stand in line, order at the front where the menu is just randomly written on pieces of paper pinned above the cashier. Same theme with the milkshake which I got to try a little sample of (extras from the blender! right time, right place)... made with really thick amazing Icelandic ice cream, I almost bought one on the spot until I remembered that I was already going for the fries (if I were to do it again I'd choose the former... undersalted and underwhelming). Next to the grill they have a whole tray of random sauces ranging from Lea and Perrins to Heinz to Sriracha and a bunch of ruffle-cut pickles and sweet caramelized onions. Nice touch, but also somewhat necessary -- I felt like I had to accessorize a lot with these things to make the flavor of the burger worth it.

nPoOSZ4j6Gf9niXyUxVD6A.text: This is my favourite burger place. Great service, great atmosphere and great value for money .

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. The burger...best gourmet burger you will find
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Tasty fries
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Relish ..so many to choose from

GMZMQyAX1Btab8in3dLBOw.text: Pretty good burgers, thick and juicy patties with a nice seat and crunchy lettuce. Fries also really tasty. Not a fan of the bread though, was a little too thick and dry. Paid £11 for the meal. Service prompt and efficient, and the condiment bar is a nice touch. Would return if in the area!

ju8gtLzqjDb8PVIqCwWMww.text: On Vacation! Best burgers I've had ever! Period! No questions asked, they are addictive! Great place to eat and relax for a bit. Customer service is phenomenal. Recommend if looking for the best burger in town.

bO6cmv6aQp0TiYyFoPCP-w.text: Easy AMERICAN burger joint feel. No nonsense food and great people watching on the outdoor seating.

GKIg3F-cDXP-zIw6VwfnQQ.text: 5 stars for a very good burger in England. We are from the US & My teenaged son almost cried tears of happiness as this was the closest burger to a "real" us burger he had experienced during our two week trip.Brioche bun, perfectly cooked - fantastic fries. It was all good -just a two minute walk north of the Oxford street madness. Fairly priced for central London.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom

8CiPujTQHpUh8WbanTtgLw.text: Review is not on the food but on staff. Ordered a burger and fries - price was under 10 pounds - gave a 20 pound note - change was based on 10 pounds. Now - it was apparent I am a American but I can count - when I raised it - all I got was a shrug and a look like he could not understand me. I asked for the 20 pound note back and decided to charge it.

4UGS6WWU3wqURTZQO1J9vg.text: The London fast casual burger scene is one that is evolving for the better, so my expectations were high when I stumbled across the very positively rated Tommi's Burger Joint. While it was good, I wouldn't classify it as anything better than A-OK.Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?Atmosphere is where Tommi's really shines. While you're smack dab in the middle of a pretty well off part of London, you'd honestly think you were in a trendy dive in the East Village. While I'll admit that the ~20 minutes that I waited for my Steak Burger was a bit much, but friendly service offset that. Star Granted. Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?For London proper, my acceptable range for a burger that doesn't come from a chain is somewhere below £10. At £8.90, my steak burger from Tommi's was within this range, and while this was by nearly every definition a 'small' burger, it just squeaks by in the value category, especially when the standard burger is priced more along the lines of £6. Have a look:yelp.com/user_local_phot…Star Granted. Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?A good burger? Yes. The bun was fluffy and buttery in a day and age when burger buns have been neglected, and the cheese and lettuce were fair enough, although nothing special. Now, my burger was defined as a "steak burger", and while I'm not sure what that means, the patty here didn't taste any different from a regular burger. On top of that, there honestly wasn't a whole lot of flavor here, which was disappointing. I'd have loved some additional flavor in the patty, or some spice, but it seems as though Tommi's places a large emphasis on the topping that you can add yourself as opposed to the default flavor of the burger. I'm not a huge fan of that approach, but to each their own. Single Star Granted. Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?The fast casual burger scene in London is so competitive that I simply can't recommend Tommi's incrementally over some of the alternatives in the area. No Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Steak Burger (+ Cheese): 8.90

qAC2VkG1rhTEKP1xnYv2hg.text: Burger time already! It is still junk food, but I feel less guilty than eating sweets. This is where I go when I need my daily joint...of burgers!This place is fantastic on the inside and just by entering you get the idea that you will be eating one tasty and juicy burger.As a burger expert, I must say the ones they make here rank in my top 10. They are big enough to fill me for a few hours and taste authentic.The location is not so good, but it is worth visiting if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Say yes
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Monsters and Men obviously love Tommi's burgers.

KcMSpqOCoNF_nNKGxWvodA.text: Definitely good spot to grab some burger. Not really outstanding but serves a good quality food. I like the arrangement of the seats and the cooking area. The food is basically made in front of your eyes (and you can feel the heat of the stove while lining up :).Big plus for additional self-service options that make it possible to customize your burger with the pickles and sauce of your choice. Though may be hard to get your toppings right when in rush.Overall the burger was quite tasty. Meat was cooked exactly as requested (medium-rare) and it is of fine quality.

o1ppBiQ5xcDIdT-QanWicw.text: Tommi's Burger Joint. Difficult, very difficult. I don't even know where to begin. Just too much yum to handle.This burger joint is very very very popular amongst the kids at my university. And I can understand why, the student night option is great and saves you money on beer.But the burgers. O' the burgers. They are cooked to perfection and you can build them any which way you want. The burger is smaller than what you'd expect if you compare it to other burger places in London. But for what it lacks in size, it makes up for in taste.I usually go for the single with bacon and cheese with fries. I always add some hot sauce goodness and BBQ deliciousness at their sauce counter, which is always STOCKED UP. They have other options, however I haven't tried any of them yet. The steak burger sounds amazing, while the double patty burger looks a bit too filling in my opinion, BUT HEY, that's just me.The one thing that's annoying is the place is pretty tiny. Even though they have seats outside, we all know what london's weather is like. But other than that, this place is amazing.

bc95vk7s_qAp88R50BNc6A.text: After meaning to go there ever since I read it was a favourite of the beckhams, today was finally the day! Not really being a big meat eater, the options were limited to either a veggie burger or the burger of he month - chargrilled chicken with avocado. After a careful deliberation, the mention of avocado swayed me for the chicken. At almost 9 pound it was on par with prices at other decent burger chains - meat liquor, patty & bun and honest, so couldn't quibble. The burger was delicious, the chicken was chargrilled to perfection and the salad and avocado complete a really lovely burger. I didn't try the fries as I'm not a massive fan of thin shoestring fries. If you're in the area, definitely call in for a burger and I'm told they have a special offer for students on a Monday.. Another plus point.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Burger of the month

ack_eS89iTsyRDDilfGhCA.text: This was the final stop, #3, in our London hipster burger tour.  Tommi's was definitely as solid as Patty & Bun and Honest, but not strong enough to take the lead definitively from P&B.  They have a super simple menu which reduces decision anxiety, that was a plus.  Well, at least until you get to the fixin's area, definitely some decision anxiety there. From their menu, you have the choice of a burger, veggie burger, or steak burger.  That's it.  You can get cheese, bacon, and béarnaise or cocktail sauce as optional toppings before you get your burger.  Easy, right?  Well, yes, until you get to the aforementioned (free) fixin's bar.  There you will find pickles, jalapeños, caramelized onions, horseradish and dozens of bottled sauces from Sriracha to A-1 steak sauce.  Lots of choices, looked like a Bloody Mary bar.  I chose a few jalapeños for my burger.The burger was very good but it was no P&B  invention; just a very well-rounded burger.  My wife's veggie burger was made of encrusted black beans and she said it was the best burger of that variety she's had.  Chips were standard, like Burger King fries to be honest.  Overall, recommended. I think it's a toss-up between Honest and Tommi's for #2.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. The burger. Good but not epic.
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. The fixin's bar.

H5xezxKdg6G9IAHnxhPgcA.text: OK, I must confess it took me quite a while to find the street this venue is at. I am not very good with directions. But when I finally found it and walked through the doors the huge queue did not scare me. A bunch of my friends kept saying: "this is the best burger in town, you must have it", and I was determined to try it, no matter what. The queue was big but it didn't take a lot of time to get my order, I think the biggest problem is finding a table, if you didn't save one before ordering. But let's talk about food! The burgers are indeed delicious, juicy and yummy. Basically you choose if you want a regular burger, a cheeseburger or a steak burger and add some toppings (like bacon or sauces) you might want with it. Are you a vegetarian? No problem, they have veggie option. Also, they are pretty flexible in changing the order or the ingredients inside the burger (which you may know is not very common in London), so if you want something different or want your burger cooked another way they encourage you to let them know, so your experience will be even better. Come and try, you will not regret it.

fWJzk3NEVhATs29c3b7v7g.text: I've enjoyed all of the burgers within the burger triangle of Marylebone.  Even though Patty and Bun and Meatliquor have delicious burgers, Tommi's is my favourite.  The menu is simple, the process is easy to get a burger by ordering at the counter, the music is fun, and the burger and fries are just damn good.  There's nothing fancy about the burger and fries.  No secret sauce or added items.  They're simple and original - just the way a burger and fries should be.  I usually order the "Offer of the Century" which includes burger, fries and a soft drink for 9.90 GBP which is a great deal for London.Another thing I love about Tommi's is that it's self serve with all of the awesome extras.  They have pickles, jalapeños, mayo, mustards, ketchups, all kinds of hot sauces including sriracha and steak sauce. You name it - they have it.  This way you can make your burger to your liking.Keep in mind that it can get pretty busy at peak times for lunch and dinner so go early if you want to sit and enjoy your burger.Would I go back?  Hells YES!  It's on the favorites list.

J85rSGAyan8HvkHI5b18SQ.text: It is not very often that I queue for food, especially at lunch time.  But, having decided to come here, queue we did.  It wasn't too bad a queue time and it gave you some time to review and think about what delight you might order.Burger (with cheese and bacon) and fries (with a free drink) came to around £11.  This is typically more than I would usually spend on my lunch but given the reviews, was hopeful that it would be worth it. As you queue, if you want to eat in, there is the slight worry that you might not get a seat.  Inside was full but, as we stood queuing you realise that there is a reasonable turn over of tables and the diners do not usually stick around chatting too much once finished.  The speed in which they clear your basket possibly helps this as you don't want to be seen to be sitting at an empty table just chatting whilst diners queue for a a table.You order, grab a table and wait for your food.  Your name is called and you flag to say that it is yours and then your basket is brought to you.  I have to say, the basket of food was delicious.  Biting through the soft bun into a juicy burger was delightful.  The basket held a pile of chips.  Lots of chips.  This meal is one of those that you think 'never going to eat all of that' but, also the type of meal that you think 'that bite was lovely, I am going to chew slowly so I can savour the taste' whilst, at the same time thinking 'let's chew quickly so I can take another bite'!  Before you know it, the burger is gone.The chips are just as nice, they are good chips and what a pile.  Never going to eat all of that and at lunch time.......oh..... I ate them all!!  Gone.  I cleared that basket of food in record time.Just as well there is a little walk back to the office......

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom

GoNnDuwKv57hYon6ybLxeg.text: Tommi's Burger Joint is back...and I have to say me like it! I'm generally not the one who's always floating on the wave of the hip places, but given that this joint is in a rather unhip neighbourhood - aka corporately boring Marylebone - I am actually quite happy about this addition.I've been to Tommi's for lunch yesterday; I got there right around noon and that was a good thing as the lunch crowd started to pour in just after me. I ordered the "Deal of the Century", which includes a burger, fries and a drink. Although they have a couple of sauces on sale, I don't think they're necessary as they also offer a wide variety of free condiments, such as various ketchups, mayos, chilli sauce & my absolute favourite...the caramalised onion. (They are that good and I wouldn't be surprised if they started charging for them soon.)Like I said, I like Tommi's Burger Joint - especially for the fact that it's dared to come to a rather bland location. I just hope that they won't get this silly idea to expand their emporium in a Byron style fashion...as soon as I see another Burger Joint popping up, they will have lost me as a costumer. I plea you: stay unique!

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom. Highly recommend smothering your burger with the caramelized onions!

6UQBJf6Lb6SgDQ3O0ttMwA.text: What a great little burger joint!I'd like to give these guys 3.5 stars, I think 3 is too low, however, they're not the best in London, and a 4 is a bit to high when you compare to these!Recommended first by Yelp friends and then by some friends who are local to the area, you have to wonder what all the hype is about.If you know me I'm a great lover of burgers that aren't overcooked and these don't fail to disappoint, so if you order it rare, it'll come rare! Tommi's gets a few bonus points for that straight up.Tasty burgers, with a whole host of pickles, sauces, condiments and accompaniments that'll allow you to tailor your patty to exact personal preferences.Try the steak burger, it simply melts!I love the idea of free coffee to, but they always seem to be out when I'm there.The French fries are also pretty good, but note they need to be ordered separately, and once you start adding to your order, it's quite easy to run up the price of your meal.Limited seating, also means that sometimes you might need to wait too.

1_qtMDY7cXbg4TG6pCpTDw.text: The queues at Patty & Bun and Meat Liquor were huge but thanks to my addiction to bookmarking and the glorious Yelp app we identified Tommi's close by and weren't disappointed. Firstly, we were able to walk straight up to the counter and order - no wait! And you pay upfront so no need to spend the rest of the evening vainly attempting to wave down some hipster excuse for a server a la Meat Liquor.As for the burgers - the meat was excellent. Tasty, juicy, beautifully cooked. Extremely satisfying. Fries were good too. Don't make the mistake of shelling out £1 for bearnaise sauce or whatever other weird condiment they have at the till. Just around the corner is the world's greatest selection of condiments, including horseradish, wholegrain mustard, caramelised onions and multiple types of BBQ sauce. I had them all! No need to be put off by the simplicity of the menu, therefore (which is basically: burger, or cheeseburger) as you can add all the flavours you need yourself. Highly recommended especially if you want something quick and casual that is decent value for money - £10.50 gets you a burger, fries and soda.

Ka-7Wd94pVXPk1dNq9C5Qw.text: I love these burgers! I remember queueing for ages when they opened, and now the London crowd has moved on a little bit but the burgers continue to be amazing! The steak burger is my favourite, with chipotle mayo sauce.

nmCjNKSuyQ8wYqsaoau6UA.text: Went in on a Sunday night. The set up is quite nice with a range of hot sauces and condiments. Burger was slightly under done to my liking, but overall a decent experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tommi's Burger Joint - London, United Kingdom
